  • Method Details

    • getDistinctCounties

      public List<String> getDistinctCounties()
      Retrieves a list of unique counties from the charging stations database. This method queries the database to find all distinct counties where charging stations are located and returns them in alphabetical order. It is for filtering charging stations by county.
      Returns:
      a list of strings, each representing a unique county name where charging stations are located; the list is sorted alphabetically and will be empty if no counties are found or if an error occurs during database access

    • getStationsByCounty

      public List<ChargingStation> getStationsByCounty(String county)
      Retrieves a list of charging stations located in a given county. This method queries the database for all charging stations that match the given county and constructs a list of ChargingStation objects from the results. Each ChargingStation object includes details such as station ID, county, address, and the number of chargers at that station.
      Parameters:
      county - the name of the county to search for charging stations
      Returns:
      a list of ChargingStation objects that are located in the specified county; this list will be empty if no stations are found in that county or if an error occurs during database access

    • getChargersByStationId

      public List<Charger> getChargersByStationId(int stationId)
      Retrieves a list of chargers located at a specified station. This method queries the database to find all chargers associated with the given station ID and constructs a list of Charger objects from the retrieved data.
      Parameters:
      stationId - the ID of the station for which chargers are to be retrieved
      Returns:
      a list of Charger objects for the specified station; this list will be empty if no chargers are found or if an error occurs during the database access

    • checkChargerAvailability

      public boolean checkChargerAvailability(int chargerID)
      Checks if a specific charger is available for use. This method queries the charger's status from the database and determines if it is marked as "Available".
      Parameters:
      chargerID - the ID of the charger whose availability is to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the charger is available, false if the charger is not available or if any errors occur during database access

    • updateChargerStatus

      public boolean updateChargerStatus(int chargerID, String status, LocalDateTime sessionStartTime, Integer customerID)
      Updates the status, session start time, and current user of a charger based on the chargerID.
      Parameters:
      chargerID - the ID of the charger to update
      status - the new status to set for the charger
      sessionStartTime - the start time of the charger session, can be null
      customerID - the ID of the customer using the charger, can be null if no user is associated
      Returns:
      true if the update was successful and affected at least one row, false otherwise

    • updateChargingTransaction

      public void updateChargingTransaction(int transactionID, LocalDateTime endTime, BigDecimal energyConsumed, BigDecimal totalCost)
      Updates the details of an existing charging transaction in the database.
      Parameters:
      transactionID - the unique identifier of the charging transaction to be updated
      endTime - the end time of the charging session
      energyConsumed - the total amount of energy consumed during the charging session, measured in kWh
      totalCost - the total cost incurred for the charging session

    • fetchStartTimeForTransaction

      public LocalDateTime fetchStartTimeForTransaction(int transactionID)
      Fetches the start time of a charging transaction from the database based on the transaction ID provided. This method queries the database for the start time of a specific transaction and returns it as a LocalDateTime object.
      Parameters:
      transactionID - of the charging transaction for which the start time is to be fetched
      Returns:
      the start time of the transaction as a LocalDateTime object; returns null if the transaction cannot be found or if there is a database access error

    • calculateDurationHours

      public BigDecimal calculateDurationHours(LocalDateTime startTime, LocalDateTime endTime)
      Calculates the Duartion in hours of a charging station.
      Parameters:
      startTime -
      endTime -
      Returns:
      the duration in hours in which the charging transaction lasted

      Parameters:

      chargerID -
      Returns:
      energyConsumed

      Returns:
